Huron Meadows Metropark (Brighton).conditions: I started skiing about 12:30, classic. Skate lanes were hard and fast - pick out your most stable skis of you plan to skate anywhere but Buck's Run.There are classic tracks beside all skate trails. They vary from rock hard nice tracks (Cedar Trace / contractor's trail) to a mix of nice track/skied -in snow-blow track (golf course trails) to deep perfect tracks (Buck's Run). Connector trails did have track: the trail to Cedar Trace had no track, and the trail directly adjacent to Buck's Run had no track. No track was set where the snow depth wasn't there. Overall, I had a good classic ski! It's was already 28 when I got to the park, but Toko Yellow kick wax worked pretty well on the mix of snow conditions.

Nubs Nob (Harbor Springs).conditions: All trails power-tilled flat with a classic track and wide skate deck. Conditions are very good.

nubsNob.xcTrails: All trails will be power-tilled and tracked this morning.
nubsNob.comments: Yesterday we experienced a surprise lake effect snowstorm that left over 4 inches of snow on the slopes. That fresh snow has now been groomed into our base and conditions appear to be excellent. The XC trails are being power-tilled and tracked this morning. The soup of the day is roasted tomato with bacon and/or tortellini. Pintail Peak opens on Friday morning. The Big Park opens on Saturday. Lifts will spin from 9:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. today. Make it a great day at Nub's Nob.
